WorkItem.Description:
at wpf-40156\Toolkit-development\DataVisualization\LayoutTransformControl.cs
line 116:
                    "<Grid x:Name='LayoutRoot' Background='{TemplateBinding Background}'>" +
should be
                     "<Grid x:Name='LayoutRoot' >" +
since Grid has no Background Property. 
This bug causes several instances of NotSupportedException (Cannot convert the value in attribute 'Property' to object of type 'System.Windows.DependencyProperty'.) and XamlObjectWriterException  (Failed to create a 'DependencyProperty' from the text 'Background'.) to be reported in the VS 2010 Output window when you run a program that uses a Chart.

Comments.Message: Actually, Grid does have a Background property.  However, I was getting this error, as well, but once I modified the source code per your change above, the error went away.   Very strange.  I am curious how you narrowed it down to this line of code.  I have System.Xaml.pdb loaded, but it won't show me the source code where the error is occuring, so I had no idea how to narrow it down.

You're right: Grid does have a Background property, and so does LayoutTransformControl (via its base class Control). Probably, the reason for the failure to resolve the property is the missing TargetType on the ControlTemplate. I don't remember how I narrowed it down to that line of code, this bug is almost a year old now (and nothing's been done about it).
Confirmed. the writen code changes fixes the problem.
